> It sounds a bit like the program at the Univ. of Sussex, which I did
> run across in my search:
>
> http://www.sussex.ac.uk/informatics/1-3-2-2-7-1-2.html
>
> Have you (or anyone) heard anything about that program?

Yeah the Sussex program is supposed to be pretty good. I've actually been
talking with Phil Husbands off and on, and he seems like a really great
guy. That school would be great if you want to lay off the CS because they
have one of the best evolutionary biology departments in the world.

> That's too bad.  That does sound like it might be a significant issue
> for me.  Do they not offer research assistantships, or work programs,
> or something similar?

I can't say much about Birmingham (I'm sure Kennon will chime in), but the
usual process in the UK for international students is to apply for an ORS
(Overseas Research Award) which covers the difference between UK and
international tuition, and then from there apply for something like a
departmental or school fellowship. Both University College London and
Sussex do it that way.

Joe

--
